file_content.text: [Mercifully, there is no one in here anymore.]
Approach. I am Bay-Yon Siu, of the Sanej Temple.
Hey! You, the one who killed the nekghoul! Open the lock, this holocron is crazy.
Calm yourself. I am incapable of madness. Madness is internal chaos, and there is no chaos, only harmony.
Back up. What did you call the dead thing?
Wait, what did I kill?
Nekghouls. He named them, not me.
Before I open that door, maybe you want to tell me who's in there.
Who's that captive?
He is the Jedi Knight Danah Jor. He came here seeking battle with the nekghouls.
Of course I did. Anyone could sense the darkness here. And you, old man, are the source.
Danah misunderstands. The nekghouls became Force sensitive and activated me. I have taught them, but only to help them master themselves.
Had he not invaded their territory, my lessons would have sunk in better.
Are you a holo or what?
My body perished long ago. This holocron projects my recorded personality, which we Jedi use to educate future generations.
Great, a pretentious holocron.
I was not perfect in life, nor am I now. But I teach what I can.
The nekghouls activated me when they became Force sensitive. I saw them quest for knowledge and began teaching them.
All they learned is better ways to kill. You saw it.
This Jedi Knight, Danah Jor, entered the warren. He sought battle, and the nekghouls... reacted.
How can you justify teaching predators the Force?
You taught them the Force?
Humans are predators, as are Twi'leks, Togruta and other sentients. Nekghouls, also, can choose their path.
He keeps saying that, but he's been trying to teach them manners for years. It won't work.
Why are they keeping him alive?
Explain this cage.
The nekghouls are currently drawing power from dark emotions.
Say it! They tear out colonists' hearts in front of me because they feed on fear and disgust.
Then this is no theoretical threat--they're sadistic, premeditated.
So they've attacked colonists.
What they do is from ignorance, not hatred. If you lived in a cave all your life, the first time you saw light it would be painful.
The darkness would comfort you, and you would only go toward light again when you found the courage. That is how it is with nekghouls.
Why are you teaching these creatures? How can you defend them?
Nobody can justify that.
Some Sith have done worse before choosing another path.
He's mad. There's hundreds of those things beneath us, by the reactor. He sees them as no threat, but they can't be allowed to live.
All right, we're gone. I'm popping this lock.
We're getting out. Now.
I'm popping this lock. You, the living one, get ready to run.
Whatever. I'm getting him out.
Thank the Force! Just cover me for thirty seconds at that control panel.
There are hundreds of rakghouls and nekghouls in the deep warrens by the reactor. They can't be allowed to live.
Revenge is not the Jedi way, Danah. Your plan will create ruin and poison.
The creatures are dangerous, but I would hear both sides.
This requires consideration.
How much ruin and poison are we talking?
Wait a second.
He wishes you to use that control panel to fire the reactor and lower its shielding.
If it wipes out these nekghouls or whatever it was I just killed, I'm listening.
Brief me.
At that control panel, I can override the safety features on the reactor.
I'll listen to the one who's been fighting these things, thanks.
I trust him more.
No! Imprisonment has driven him mad. He would lower the reactor shielding with that control panel.
That would bathe them all in radiation. It would be the mass murder of sentient creatures and make this place uninhabitable.
If you don't like what you're about to see, turn off.
Then don't watch, holoman.
It won't take long. Just let me reach that control panel and lower the reactor shielding.
What you plan is mass murder. No thinking creature deserves to die a lingering death from radiation. There are alternatives.
They were born of dark side sorcery. They cannot change.
It merely requires time, which I have. They cannot harm me. Leave me here with them and seek death no more.
If they can think and choose, they can learn. Reach them if you can. We will go.
Teach them, then.
Your trust will not be forgotten. Now free this man.
I'm free, but they live unpunished. If I can't give justice to their victims, what will I do?
Return to the surface. Then meditate upon the actions that led you here.
Learn from your mistake.
You've been through a shock. This is normal. Talk to the other Jedi, get some help.
You'll work it out.
I... I will do so. Thank you for saving my life.
Return to the Jedi. Tell them they can't invade this place like you did.
Tell the Jedi to stay away.
Yes... no one can enter here in hate. They will be fed upon, as you were.
The surface is that way. Figure it out.
Run, you idiot.
You are a remarkable person not to give in to instinct, a lesson these nekghouls must also learn.
It may be generations, but what is done with the dark can be undone by the light. One day, they will walk on Taris as humans do.
Professor Vraal here. We got everything recorded. Good work.
We heard the plan. We'll keep watch on the site. Now, clear out of there before something hears all this talking.
These things are a danger to every colonist on the planet. Take them out.
Danah's right. They all die.
Can you feel their agony, Danah? Even I, a collection of circuits, feel it.
I hate him, but he's right about one thing. There's nothing good in this place.
Professor Vraal here. You did great, we got everything recorded. Now get out of there!
The multimeter's going crazy with radiation. Run! Run, and never look back!
[You thought you heard breathing from inside, but now it has stopped.]
